comment: One of my many pet-peeves at conferences ... The ID Badge ! Nearly per cent of the Badges are flipped - as a result you end up seeing a blank card . Why don't they print names on both sides ? Also , the font size ... so small , it is often impossible to read .
amr:
# ::snt One of my many pet-peeves at conferences ... The ID Badge ! Nearly per cent of the Badges are flipped - as a result you end up seeing a blank card . Why don't they print names on both sides ? Also , the font size ... so small , it is often impossible to read .
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (o / organization
            :name (n / name
                  :op1 "ID"
                  :op2 " Badge")
            :ARG1-of (ii / include-91
                  :ARG2 (o2 / organization
                        :name (n2 / name
                              :op1 "Petpeeve")
                        :quant (m2 / many)
                        :poss (ii2 / i)
                        :location (c / conference))))
      :snt2 (f / flip-01
            :ARG1 (b / badge
                  :ARG1-of (ii3 / include-91
                        :ARG2 (b2 / badge)
                        :ARG3 (n3 / nearly
                              :op1 (p / percentage-entity
                                    :value 1))))
            :ARG0-of (c2 / cause-01
                  :ARG1 (e / end-up-03
                        :ARG1 (y / you)
                        :ARG2 (s / see-01
                              :ARG0 y
                              :ARG1 (c3 / card
                                    :ARG1-of (b3 / blank-02))))))
      :snt3 (c4 / cause-01
            :ARG0 (a / amr-unknown)
            :ARG1 (p2 / print-01
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG0 (t / they)
                  :ARG1 (t2 / thing
                        :ARG2-of (n4 / name-01))
                  :location (s2 / side
                        :mod (b4 / both))))
      :snt4 (s3 / size
            :mod (f2 / font)
            :ARG1-of (h / have-degree-91
                  :ARG2 (s4 / small)
                  :ARG3 (s5 / so)
                  :ARG6 (p3 / possible-01
                        :polarity -
                        :ARG1 (r / read-01
                              :ARG1 (t3 / thing
                                    :ARG2-of (s6 / size-01
                                          :ARG1 f2))
                              :frequency (o3 / often))))))

comment: The Women in Data Science conference in Pune , held recently , had a no-paper policy . They used an app instead of a physical badge . Wish more conferences follow suit !
amr:
# ::snt The Women in Data Science conference in Pune , held recently , had a no-paper policy . They used an app instead of a physical badge . Wish more conferences follow suit !
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (h / have-03
            :ARG0 (c / conference
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "Women"
                        :op2 "in"
                        :op3 "Data"
                        :op4 "Science")
                  :ARG1-of (h2 / hold-04
                        :time (r / recent))
                  :location (c2 / city
                        :name (n2 / name
                              :op1 "Pune")))
            :ARG1 (p / policy-01
                  :ARG2 (p2 / paper
                        :polarity -)))
      :snt2 (u / use-01
            :ARG0 (t / they)
            :ARG1 (a / app
                  :ARG1-of (ii / instead-of-91
                        :ARG2 (b / badge
                              :mod (p3 / physical)))))
      :snt3 (w / wish-01
            :ARG0 (ii2 / i)
            :ARG1 (f / follow-suit-06
                  :ARG0 (c3 / conference
                        :quant (m2 / more)))))
